title: Clinical Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward remote interview, my time was well-spent and I felt the process was effective. I declined due to lack of chances to practice. School based seems well run program.
Interview Questions: What your philosophy of supervision?

title: Conselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (South San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, but left some information out of the job description such as mental intensity. Also the time for the interactive felt shorter and having more time to interact with the students on campus would be better to see more of the work that happens at the school.
Interview Questions: What is some ways you take care of yourself mentally?

title: Graduate Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Application. Then I received an email to schedule a phone screener. It was followed up by a zoom interview with the hiring manager and supervisor. There was an issue with getting an update. HR was slow to reach out.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are you looking for in training? What do you look for in supervision? What is a strength and weakness?

title: Behavioral Clinician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Met with two interviewers on zoom for one hour. They asked various questions about me and my previous work experience and offered the position a few days later. The interiviewers were extremely kind
Interview Questions: Describe one success and one failure from your previous position

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: The staff asked general questions to learn my experience with working with youth. The staff was helpful by providing information regarding the position and explained day-to-day tasks. All the staff and supervisors are caring individuals!
Interview Questions: Experience working with at-risk youth?

title: School Based Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely slow and there was poor communication throughout. The lack of communication was off-putting there were many unanswered calls and emails. Do not recommend it. The interviewers were also late for interviews.
Interview Questions: How have you committed yourself to understanding and aiding in the pursuit of equity and inclusion in your professional and or personal life?

title: Health Information Specialist Interview

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview

Interview Questions: What has brought you joy in the past about your work?

title: Associate Therapist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted virtually and each open position was described. The interviewers wanted to know about my experience and what I get that my strengths and weaknesses were and how my experience would benefit me in the position.
Interview Questions: How would you work with a child of color and their family?

title: Youth Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online. After about two to three weeks the agency calls you and goes over the requirements. If you are still interested they set up a group interview via zoom.

title: Technical Support Interview

Describe your approach to issues of DEI.

How does your experience fit in with this job?

title: Administrative Interview

title: Quality Assurance Health Information Specialist Interview

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: First received a phone call from the principal, very friendly, gave me an overall introduction to the school and their values/mission. Then the other hour was an interview where they ask you questions and then you get to ask them questions.

title: Counselor Interview

Following that interview, I got a callback and my onboarding process started after that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you've decided to run towards a population that some people would rather run away from?

title: Executive Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Two-tier interview. The first is a group interview and the second is with the executive. Really good turnaround time and the questions are pretty standard to what's out there as test questions for these kinds of roles.

title: Estagiário Interview

Interview Descriptions: o entrevistador deixa bem a vontade e fica somente focado nas habilidades de cada candidato. educado, rapido e direto ao ponto, todas as perguntas tipicas de uma entrevista de emprego
Interview Questions: como voce se enxerga em 6 anos?

title: Bilingual Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, complete and very professional. The first one is through the phone, the second is a group interview and the third one is directly one on one. The staff is very professional and kind.

title: Resource Family Home Advocate Interview

title: Program Assistant Interview

title: Clinical Intervention Specialist Interview

title: Program Assistant Interview

We were told the group interview was so that they could see all of us interact with each other and to help hurry the process.

title: Direct Service Community Based Interview

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a screening phone call one day later. We scheduled a group interview for next week with 5 other candidates for similar positions. After I got a call for an interactive interview at my specific site.
Interview Questions: What would you do if it was your first day and a student calls you a B word?

title: Parent Partner Interview

Interview Descriptions: Called for phone screening then brought in twice for interviews. The phone screening took about 20 minutes am the in person interviews took about 1 hour each on separate days.  The interviews took place in Santa Ana.
Interview Questions: 2 separate sessions 1-2 weeks apart with 1-2 interviewers -Scenario questions , why should we select you? type questions

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted for phone screening and group interview scheduling 10 days after application submission. Group interview with a few other candidates and two recruiters for various other positions at their San Leandro office. Contacted with invitation to schedule second interview with local team  4 business days after the group interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you interacted with someone that was culturally different from you.

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: First they called and did an interview over the phone. Afterwards they invited you to a group interview with around 8 or 9 other people. We were all asked a series of hypothetical and anecdotical questions that we answered taking turns. The interview took around 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Some questions that came up were  "speak of a situation in which you've had to relate to someone that was very different to you" or "children are very curious, how much of your private life would you share with them?"

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: The group interview lasted about 1.5 hours. The interviews gave several scenarios to which each interviewee had to answer. This made the interview feel quite long. But, the interviewers were very friendly and did not rush anyone, which was a bonus. the last half of the interview was the the interviewers providing information on the company and what to expect if hired.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who has screamed profanity at you in front of an auditorium?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions:
A screening call, a first interview and then a second interview. The second interview included a computer test on Microsoft Word and Excel. 
The whole process was made very easy by Seneca. They were incredibly kind and made the interview a lot less stressful. Both interviews were one on one, meeting with different people each time. 
They checked my references shortly after the first interview, and were very communicative throughout the process of doing so. Overall, I would say it was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were faced with a challenge that didn't have a good outcome

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
The whole process took me about 5 weeks. First, they contacted me via phone to set up a group interview. The group interview took 2 full hours and included 6 other people who were mostly interviewing for different positions in different locations, so it didn't feel too competitive.
Next, they called me to invite me to interview with 2 directors of the program. This was a pretty straightforward interview with standard questions (strengths, weaknesses) as well as requiring examples of your past experiences and how you handled them.
They called me immediately to set up a 1 hour interactive interview at one of the public schools they work with. I had no guidelines on how this interview was supposed to go or what was expected of me. When I arrived, the interviewer was unfriendly and I could tell she immediately disliked me, or was extremely annoyed I was disrupting her day. She told me that she would be watching how I interact with the kids and adults, but not to be too coddling or give the kids too much attention. I was confused, but I feel I did my best considering the vague instructions. I only got to spend 20 minutes with the kids outside for recess and 10 minutes inside the classroom, so I couldn't really get a feel for the job. She ended the interview by asking me a few questions, and I left with a bad gut feeling.
Sure enough, a few days later HR called saying I was not recommended for that position, but I might be a fit for a position in one of their non-public schools, which is what I originally applied for anyway. I had to do yet another interactive interview, except this one was 3 hours, 2 hours in the classrooms and 1 talking to the director. This one went much better as I was able to actually see how the job would be like and interact more with the kids. About a week later, I was contacted with an offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the kids asked you personal/inappropriate questions?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went in for an initial group interview in a room with 3 other candidates and one interviewer. we were asked a lot of hypothetical based questions to see what we would do in those situations.  I moved on to a solo interview a few weeks later, where more personal questions were asked about myself.
Interview Questions: What would you do if it's your first day on the job and a child calls you the "B" word?

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: In person interview about 1 hour in length. Interviewer gave plenty of time for interviewee to ask questions. Interviewer seemed to want interviewee to have some prior knowledge and experience with the given population.
Interview Questions: What strengths do you bring to this role and what would you have trouble with?

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: A big group was interviewed, which was unknown to many of the applicants. It was an unstructured format and vague questions with answers that became redundant after such a large group. However the staff was very friendly and inviting!
Interview Questions: How one provides empathy for caregivers

title: Bilingual Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with three panel members interviewing me and another applicant. The first half of the interview was them asking questions about your experience and how it relates to the position. Then, they give you a worksheet to translate.
Interview Questions: 1. Working at Seneca, there is the possibility that the children/youth may act aggressively towards you, so why do you want to work at Seneca?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screening then a group interview. The group interview was about 1.5-2 hours long.  They told the candidates to give them 4-5 business days before checking if we would get a second interview which would be an interview at one of their school sites. I called after  4 business days and was told they would contact the sites and they would be in touch with me. They called a couple of days later to set up the second interview for the next week and the next day they reached out to my references. a couple of days after that I got a call from HR that the position was filled. they asked if I would be interested in a different position and I said yes so he said he would send my application to that department. He said if they were interested then I would have to do another interview. I had to wait another 4-5 business days to reach out for an update. I was really disappointed and frustrated with the process and how things were handled by their HR so I didn't bother following up.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to students asking you personal/inappropriate questions?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview and then scheduled for a group interview. Following the group interview, I was contacted by the site director who then scheduled me for a 2-hour interview a week later. The first hour was 1:1 and the second hour was an interactive, which entailed me visiting two different classrooms for 30 minutes each.
Interview Questions: These kids will call you every name in the book and spit on you, why would you want to do this work?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Process first stared with a brief phone interview that went over job description and requirements. After that a group interview about a week later. Group had 4 other people, a few applying for the same job and others applying for jobs at other locations. Questions were mostly scenario based.

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Not a job for professionals with rent to pay. Pay can not compare to most professional jobs. Interview was full of college children. When asking questions regarding employee  training, they were unable to answer. That's scary!!

title: Behavioral Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Made initial contact within a week of applying. Had a group interview then somewhat of a panel for the second interview. The interviews were very relaxed in the best way, best interviews I've ever been to.

title: Lead Clinician Interview

title: Health Information Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied  to posting I saw on indeed, received a call  for a phone interview about a week later. Got invited for a group interview with a panel of people. She emailed me directions and a thank you email l.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position

title: Classroom Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: First, I got a phone interview. The person on the phone described more about the position and some benefits. Everyone was applying for a similar position at a different location, so there wasn't any competition. It was a relaxed interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with this population? , What will you do if the student was in crisis?

title: Program Assistant Interview

They asked standard questions such as my education, experience, why I was interested in the position, etc.  That same day I was scheduled for a group interview, that would happen the following week.  The group interview had three of us applicants and one employee interviewing us.  We took turns answering the question.

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Involved a group interview, followed with the interview at a site they thought fit for you. They would ask a lot of questions, and then in the group interview, you would freely answer and wait for a period where you would be able to talk.  The group interview seems frightening, but it's not they make it a very relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student had called you a bad word when you first enter the classroom?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Concord, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Three interview process. The first one was a group interview with 10 other applicants, the second one is at the site you will be serving and the final step is an interactive interview with the students and staff.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions...what would you do if? How do you handle?

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was very short and sweet. I applied, and received  a call to schedule an interview the next day. Two clinical directors interviewed me and asked me a series of questions regarding my experience. They were extremely friendly and sweet!
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself and your experience.

title: Bilingual Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on indeed and was contacted via phone a few days later. The phone interview was to get to know me and they explained the position qualifications. The 2nd interview was a group interview with 4 other people. We were all applying for different positions but got all the same questions. This process was long and kind of hard to not be repetitive since we were all answering the same questions. Most of the questions were situational. The 3rd interview was with 2 program supervisors they both switched off asking questions. Most questions were situational as well as previous experience.  After this they were supposed to let me know if I got the job instead they scheduled a 4th interview!!!! This interview was extremely redundant most of the questions were similar to the previous 3 interviews. The overall process took 2 months. It was so long I had 5 other offers which I accepted another job even though I really wanted this job because they took so long to get back to me.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child called you a (racial slur) b***h on your first day on the job?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Ana, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Seneca has been incredible throughout the entire process. They have a great reputation for how they treat their employees and I can see why. I have been notified and updated every step of the way. The interview was a group interview, but it was very relaxed and comfortable. The interviewer was polite and friendly and each person in the interview was just as passionate as their job as you'd hope. The facilities were also much nicer than I had expected. If you catch their interest in the first interview, they will quickly follow up with you for a second one-on-one interview.
Interview Questions: What is the most creative thing you've done on the job?

title: Health Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Ana, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: First there was an Online application. Then a phone call to go over the benefits, pay, and interview schedule.  Then a group interview.  Then a computer test. Then individual interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Preschool Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Being that I had Senecas training manual I though the interview went great And I have over 3 year experience working  with children and with  Seneca staff  and a early childhood degree. I feel that Seneca only want to hire people of non color . I though the interview went great because I prepare for it by using their training manual and I thought I would get the job or another position as a mental health counselor but I got an email saying that they have pick someone more qualifed. I really believe that they do no want the children who are mostly black to work with someone that is black and experience that is why they have a high turnover rate I was willing to work with these kids but they rather hire non black who will not last the whole school year . When I walked around the school there was not one staff who was black . I am more than qualifed to work with these children and it is so sad how they make you go thru such a long process like two hour interview just to be told that they don't want you.  when I came in the preschool class I had the children under control and  was told they actually behaving themselves for the first time all day.  I am starting to believe Seneca does not want the  children to thrive they just want to keep getting funding for the kids without  actually hire people who are qualified to work with these youth most of there staff will not last a year .
Interview Questions: What would I do if a kid hit me ?

title: Student Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two weeks after I applied, I heard back from a recruiter. The recruiter asked why Seneca? The recruiter then went over the qualifications for this particular position and its benefits, then asked if I was still interested in moving forward. We scheduled a video interview since I was in another state. The interview lasted about an hour. Majority of the questions were situational.
Interview Questions: During a crisis, what are some things that you do or consider?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I am not completely done with the interview process, but I went through a phone call and a group interview so far. I thought that the group interview was cool for how we were able to get to know each other better, as well as understand what the environment of the workplace we will be going to might be like. I was the youngest one there, and as a recent graduate, I am thankful for any opportunity to learn from anyone. There were 5 other people in the group interview, all who were at least 5 years older than me, and I learned a lot by listening to their answers to the questions. I saw how everyone came from different backgrounds with different professional experiences, and how they were willing to work with each other in the answers. At the same time however, I could still feel the competition. The interviewer first asked us questions like "tell me about yourself" and "why Seneca?" and then moved onto more situational questions. I balanced listening to the other answers first and building off of them, with answering first for the questions that I was passionate about. I hear that the next portion of interviews is an interactive one where we are put into the classroom, so I will update this description later.
Interview Questions: Why Seneca?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Group interview went smoothly and was open for discussion. The recruiter was welcoming and engaging, while still allowing for questions and comments to aid the candidates in making an informed decision.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with working with children?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening. 1st official interview was a short chat with the principal and a walk through campus to give you a sense of the environments and how you would interact in that space. I got a second interview and did a 2nd walk through this time with a different age group. I was offered the role 3 days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and goals.

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oxnard, CA)
Interview Descriptions: A lot of questions about how you handle conflict. They were really concerned with one's ability to work in a team based decision making process regarding client care.  Then they wanted to see if you could stand by your decision regarding client treatment even if others may not habe agreed, and how would you handle a disagreement with the team.
Interview Questions: How I may have handled a difficult situation with a client then with a staff member in the padt.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview is a group interview, 2nd interview is with the program director, 3rd interview is an interactive with students. The last interview was difficult because they just throw you in the classroom while the students are learning so its hard to interact since you don't want to interrupt the class.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself, and why do you want to work with children who have behaviors

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on their website. I then received a phone call to schedule an on-site interview a week later. The interview was a group interview with two other people applying for either the same or a different position. The interview was pretty laid back and Informative. The recruiter talked about the mission of Seneca, what the position we applied for does and how it plays a part with Seneca's mission. Didn't seem like there was too much pressure and everyone was able to answer the questions giving similar answers with their own twist on it.
Interview Questions: What would be three things your coworker/supervisor say about you?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Salinas, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled for 30 minutes. Started late. Recruiter did most of the talking. Scripted. Stone-faced. No indication of follow up. Felt very odd. No warmth or rapport building. Great questions. Posting for your benefit.
Interview Questions: How would you handle this scenario: You're on the phone, your boss needs 10 copies of something for a meeting, a volunteer is at the desk, the sheriff walks in

title: Student Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 hour group interview. The interview is facilitated by a HR employee and the interview is similar to a group discussion which you need to elaborate with other employees and contribute new ideas.
Interview Questions: You will be working with clients who have different racial, cultural, and socioeconomic background. Tell me a time you have worked with similar population.

title: Student Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an HR rep about a week after sending in my resume, and was scheduled for a group interview the following week. That meeting was postponed due to a family emergency, and rescheduled for the next week. I was expecting a group interview based off the other reviews that I read about this agency, but the interview was scheduled later in the afternoon and was just the HR rep and I. It only took about 30 minutes and for she gave me the history of the company. Then she went on to some fairly informal interview questions, at which we talked about my past experience with kids and behavior and Trauma backgrounds. She then told me about the sort of General hiring information for the agency. It sounds like a really great agency to work for with a lot of growth potential, so I'm excited to hear back and see if I progressed to the next interview.
Interview Questions: Scenario: you are working with a teacher on student behavior issues, and the teacher says that one student always acts up when you're not there. how would you go about explaining to the teacher in the next steps?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. A week later an HR rep contacted me for a group interview. During my group interview, 2 other recruiters were there. They were professional and tried their best to make us feel at ease about the group interview. They tried to do this by having us do a brief breathing exercise. In my group interview, there were two others, I was the third. My overall experience with the interview was nerve wrecking. Group interviews make me nervous because I feel like I have to outsell my peers (right in front of them). A lot of it felt like a competition (which in a sense it is.) There were two position open during our interview session. The three of us were going for the classroom counselor position. The interview started off with the male recruiter elaborating about Seneca, then asked us hypothetical and personal questions about ourselves. We were given the opportunity to answer or not. However, it is obvious that it is in your best interest to answer. This is where the competition came in because you felt like you had to out answer your opponent. The interview ended with questions or concerns that you may have. I assume that there are multiple group interviews. So technically, I believe that you are not only competing with your peers that you saw during your interview, but others in other interviews as well. After the interview was over, we were handed a survey to fill out to help them improve their interview process. They emailed me a week later stating that they found someone that was more suitable for the position. As disappointed as I am, I appreciate that they emailed me to let me know instead of just letting me wonder.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Ana, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview of 6 - 8 people with 3 interviewers. Overall it felt more like a conversation than an interview, and it was very relaxed, humorous, and informational. One of the most fun interviews I've been to yet!
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me a bit about yourself.
2. The front office interacts with a wide range of people. How have you handled someone who was angry with you?
3. What would your supervisor say are your strengths? What about areas of improvement?
4. How have you helped contribute to the positive morale of the office?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They called me a week after sending in my application to offer me a group interview. The group interview was with two HR employees of Seneca and 6 other applicants of the same position and other positions. The interview consisted of 6 or so questions and took about two hours. After the questions, they talked about Seneca and the open positions' descriptions and hourly pay.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This interview was several years ago.  First we had a group interview around a table, where a person from HR asked us questions -- I only ended up answering two or three questions total.  Then I was called back for a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about having to learn how to safely restrain clients?  How do you feel about the possibility of getting bitten or kicked by a child?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Someone called me for a phone interview and to schedule a group interview. There were 2 others at the interview. I was contacted later that week for the interactive portion, where you are suppose to interact with the kids. After that there was another interview with 2 people from that site where they asked how the interactive went and similar questions to the group interview.
Interview Questions: What kind of behaviors did you notice in the classroom, how the counselor handled it, and how you would have handled it differently.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview then got called for a second interview . First interview was a group interview. Second interview was with 2 directors. First you interview with HR then you have your interview at the location you wish to work at.
Interview Questions: Why Seneca?

title: Program Assistant/Health Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview, mostly with questions about skills/background and reason for being interested in the position. They also asked some situational questions (e.g. how would you handle a typical challenging scenario that is likely to come up if you are hired). A good portion of the interview was also dedicated to explaining the position and its benefits, location possibilities, etc. In general, the interview process seemed very standardized/formalized and the interviewer was very friendly.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a complex situation in which you are dealing with multiple competing (and complex) demands on your attention while you are working in a "front desk" role at a Seneca office? (the question itself was slightly more specific than that...they actually presented a hypothetical scenario, but I don't remember the exact details of it)

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a call about a week later for a quick phone screening. During that screening I was asked one question and it was why Seneca? I answered the question and later was asked to go to a group interview. After that interview, you have an interview with the program directors and they ask you about 5 questions and if answered well they move on to an interactive interview. 

The interactive interview is good, you get to see the environment you work in and how your co-workers would handle certain situations. If you get intimidated easily I can assure you the job is not going to work. 

I have heard wonderful things about Seneca and hope to hear from them soon.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you gave feedback to someone in a superior role than you.

title: Health Information Specialist, Program Assistant, Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Really vague what you're interviewing for. There is a phone screen, group interview, and then if you're selected you will be bounced around from program to program not 100% sure what you're even interviewing for at a certain point.
Interview Questions: How do you practice self care?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: First there was a group interview. There were around 10 people and they asked questions. We all had to answer every question (make sure to answer first sometimes and in the middle at other times to show team work). It was not too stressful because you could listen to others answers first and build on them if you did not know what to say right away. Then there was an individual interview. The whole process took around a month.
Interview Questions: If you were to go to a clients house and it felt very dangerous, would you go in?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I went through their first round which was the group interview and I thought it was chill (very conversational and everyone got to speak up) until they told us that there were other candidates way ahead of us in the process and they were already deciding on making an offer. Felt like I wasted my time.
Interview Questions: Same exact question as the previous reviewers regarding how to prioritize multiple tasks at once. How do you keep yourself organized? What computer programs are you familiar with? What would your boss/supervisor or mentor say are your strengths and weaknesses? Describe a time when you handled a major conflict and what you learned from it? How would you handle a situation where a client/person was angry with you (or something of that matter)

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call, scheduled a group interview, then had a 2nd interview which had me go to a site and then speak to the directors. Haven't heard anything back yet and it's been about a week and a half. Hopefully hearing back soon because it looks like a great company!
Interview Questions: What do you do to promote self care?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is a group interview and I had to drive to the Oakland Location.  There was about 10 other people interviewing with me and one person from HR.  The HR person would ask a question and everyone would respond at their own time. If you pass this interview then you move on to a separate interview with your potential supervisor and then you also do an interactive interview with children.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was quick and was just asking questions to get to know you and see if you are a good fit for an on site interview. They did give a follow email to see if they are interested in you.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about some of your experiences on your resume?
How did you hear about Seneca?

title: Care Coordinator - Wraparound Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview 1 week after I applied online and scheduled an interview for a week following. I was told I would have a half hour to write a response to a case report prior to meeting with two supervisors for two different positions they were considering me for (also a TBS clinician).  I was called for a second interview the same afternoon.
Interview Questions: Discuss at time you had to work with someone who was very different than you and how you dealt with it?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I like the group interview because everyone was given a chance to talk so it wasn't like a competition . Some of the scenario questions were tough to answer on the spot.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if someone called you a bad name on the first day?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Ana, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Large (~8 applicants) group interview. First our interviewers introduced themselves and then they asked a series of eight questions. It was a little difficult because we did not want to interrupt anyone else and we wanted our answers to sound unique.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself using 3 adjectives

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with two upper management employees, asked basic questions about employment history and experience.  Prior to meeting with said employees, the receptionist gave me a writing sample (with a vignette) as to gauge my writing level and style.
Interview Questions: Can you describe the populations you have previously worked with?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There's a multi step interview process: first the group interview which takes about an hour, then the 2 hour computer test, and then a final interview with the director of whatever department you would be assisting. At the final interview, I was surprised with another 30 minute plus computer test in addition to the hour long interview.
Interview Questions: What do you value in a supervisor?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went quite well actually. First, you have a phone interview. Next there is a GROUP interview. I was someone that listened to each question carefully, let someone answer the question first to get a sense of how the recruiter listened and responded but, after question 1 and 2, I was one of the first to answer all the following questions. They were really straight forward and I honestly enjoyed the group interview. This give you a chance to stand out.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to become a counselors, What are some qualities you need to be a great counselor? (not kidding--- You walk into a group setting with your kiddo's and one of the students says "I don't want that (b-word) working with me", how do you respond?", You see one of your clients after work and he has a brown bag with "something" in it and gives it to his friend - what would you do?"

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: They have 3 interviews in total. First is group interview, where they ask you around 6-8 basic program assistant related questions and about your background along with other candidates who are applying for the same or similar jobs positions. Second is computer test, where they ask you very basic questions about excel, word and outlook. The test takes about 1 hour or may be even less. Lastly, they will do a final interview with the team director or CEO or the head of the department you are applying too. Again, very basic and general assistant type questions. It is usually with 2-3 people and they try to make you very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why Seneca?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I went to a group interview. Everyone was applying for different positions and they were deciding who was the best fit for every position at the same time. We were asked a few questions than explained every position available. We wrote down which position we felt would be best for us and they would decide that as well for us.
Interview Questions: Name the most creative thing you have done in a work setting.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was divided into three parts: group interview, computer test, and one-on-one interview (followed by a computer test). Love the staff that I encountered! Managers are nice and genuinely care about you.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself

title: Student Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email for a group interview. On the day, there were two interviewers and a few interviewees. I did not hear back from them so emailed and asked for updates. They returned the email promptly.
Interview Questions: What would do you if a child spits at you and cusses? Why would you want to work with them.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a phone call to schedule an on site interview a week later. Interview was a group interview with six other people applying for either the same or a different position. Interview was pretty laid back and mostly situational. Didn't seem like there was too much pressure. Everyone gave similar answers to questions but put their own twist on it.
Interview Questions: What would you do if it was your first day and one of the children calls you a bitch?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They got back to me in about a week after I applied for a group interview. The interview itself was fairly informal without a ton of structure or pressure.
Interview Questions: The work will be very challenging. Why Seneca?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Hayward, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a call after I applied within a couple of days. I was asked to go in for an in person group interview. There were around 6-7 people who came in for different positions and 2 recruiters who asked us around 10-15 questions. They were general questions about what we would do when certain situations arose and why we would be a good fit at Seneca. The interview lasts a long time and it feels like a discussion group so it is not that stressful.
Interview Questions: What kind of kids do you think you will be working with?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Rosa, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online and was contacted within a week to schedule a group interview. During the interview, three of us were being interviewed but for all different positions within the company. We all answered the same questions. They said we would be contacted for the next steps in the process.
Interview Questions: Children are very curious by nature. How much do you think is appropriate to share with the children?

title: Classroom Counselor, Youth Counselor, Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received a quick prescreening phone call after about a week after I applied online. They basically went over the benefits, starting salary, and minimum requirements for all the position. After that they scheduled a group interview with me. When I arrived, there was only one other candidate beside me who is scheduled on that day. It was more like an informal discussion than an interview with lots of situational questions. After that, the interviewer said that they will contact us about a week later. If selected, you will move on to a one on one interview with the department manager/director. But for positions like classroom counselor, you will also have an interactive test with the kids after the individual interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Behavioral Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions:
To preface my review, I actually applied for and was offered almost the exact same position at Seneca 5 years ago but I turned it down back then. This time, the process was almost exactly the same but I didn't get an offer! The first interview is a group interview with someone from HR. It's uncomfortable because everyone has to answer the same questions in succession and everyone basically said the same thing. The HR guy just read questions off of a piece of paper and didn't respond to (or even acknowledge) anyone's answers. It seemed impersonal and not a good way to screen people. My second interview took weeks to schedule because the assistant who was scheduling them kept getting the interviewers' availability wrong and had to reschedule with me 4 or 5 times. The second interview was with the two supervisors I'd be working with if I got hired. They were late and neither one was very friendly. They seemed inexperienced with interviewing. I'd expect social workers to be a bit warmer and better at putting people at ease. They told me they only had my resume from 2011 and then asked really basic questions that (again) they read off their pieces of paper. It wasn't conversational at all and I couldn't wait to leave. One of them was incessantly yawning the whole time which I thought was really unprofessional and rude. 

To be honest, everyone at this agency seems really young and inexperienced. This might be a good job for someone straight out of college but I have a lot more experience than the job required and still wasn't offered a job, even though I was offered it 5 years ago. So I don't know what they're looking for but for $17 an hour, their expectations seem a bit ridiculous!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with this particular population of children?

title: Health Information Specialist/Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2 months. You apply. If interested they email you to schedule a brief phone interview/discussion. You do group interview. Computer test (microsoft office was surprisingly really hard, excel was basics). Last interview with heads of department. Then fingerprinting. If they dont call you for the next interview, CALL THEM to check on your status. I only moved on to each step after calling them to check in when I wouldn't hear from them for a week.
Interview Questions: What are 3 adjectives to describe yourself?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with two other candidates. Other candidates were applying for the same and/or similar jobs. Two interviewers. Interviewer asks a question and each candidate has to give a response but no order is specified. The interview lasted approximately 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student called you out for having privileges that they didn't have (white/white-passing, male, able-bodied, wealthy, etc)?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: An HR recruiter calls you for a brief phone screen going over the job position, salary and benefits. If you accept, then they ask you to come in to their main office for a group interview. The group interview asks some situational but mostly standard interview questions and to have each person go around and share their answers. Slightly off tangent but I felt bad because group interviews can be nerve-racking for some, especially those with anxiety in which unfortunately one member in my group interview had and had to step out. The wait time was less than a week to do a skills test at the main office which was the next step (4 components, 1 excel and 3 word documents you have to create, very easy for those proficient in both programs). Within the week, I was contacted to have an interview with the Executive Director. The interview with the Executive Director (from the Crisis Center) went well and she offered me after our interview however, I declined because the role was very different from what I had expected (more of personal assistant than overall admin assistant).
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with scheduling?

title: Wraparound Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call regarding application and to schedule a phone interview for the following week.  The woman who interviewed me was not very warm - felt like she was reading off a list of questions - and felt hurried. Not a great experience.
Interview Questions: What are you weaknesses?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from Seneca about a week or two after applying. Then I was called and had a brief interview over the phone about myself including details about the position I am applying for. The questions they asked were basically just seeing if I fit the minimum qualifications for the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Seneca?

title: Human Resource Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got called the next day for a group interview. After, they call you if they're interested and ask for you to come in for computer based test. Still waiting for my results.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Crisis Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Thousand Oaks, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted Application. Completed a phone interview and then scheduled an in person interview. After the in person interview received response a few weeks later regarding their decision. They responded by email.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation with a violent youth?

title: Assistant Director of Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oxnard, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I received a request for a phone interview in less than a week of submitting my application/ resume. 
The interview was crisp and short; but the we had some points of discussion that felt positive and collaborative.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my background in working with children and families. Also, certain questions about statements made in my cover letter....asked to elaborate.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: i applied online and got a call 4 days later for a phone screening, and scheduled a group interview for a week later. Then had a group interview with 8 of us to 1 interviewer. All of the questions were situational, and you answer when you felt comfortable. Overall it was a pretty laid back interview, but they do not give you any feedback. They definitely already have in mind who they are looking for, and they touch on that a little bit in the beginning of the interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if it was your first day and a student called you a bitch?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1.) Initial Phone Screening
2.) Group Interview - Group of 5 people(Very easygoing and comfortable)
3.) Computer Test - Basic Excel and Word skills
4.) Interview with Potential Dept. Head or Supervisor(My initial interview was with two people, but my second and third were one on one)
Interview Questions: Why Seneca?

title: Behavioral Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was very impersonal and awkward. Group Interview. People were late. While we were waiting for others to arrive I looked around at the training center, and was really impressed by the environment. I appreciated the gender neutral bathroom attempt, although having 5 urinals and 2 toilets in a stall isn't exactly ideal or practical. Parking was a pain, I arrived 40 minutes early because we were warned about this. I had to park on a dirt road and hike up multiple flights of stairs. Interviewers seemed like actors reading a script and adding in gestures and facial expressions to make it seem more realistic.
Interview Questions: What personal details would you share with the children you would be working with?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly easy. It was a group interview with about 6 other people, and the questions had a lot to do with why you want to work there and situational questions. Questions are answered on a "whoever wants to answer" kind of basis. Interviewer was very informative and left a lot of time for interviewees to ask questions.
Interview Questions:
What would you do if a student called you a b*tch in your first day?

What would you do if you saw one of your students selling drugs but you were off duty?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a response the next day to set up an interview.  It was a group interview that took about 1.5 hrs.  Questions were more situational than about you as a person/employee.  Each interviewee spoke in no particular order, but all answered each question.  It was more of a discussion, as each interviewee could build off what the other said.  The interviewer would polish off each question with a "Seneca-like" answer, usually telling the mission and values of Seneca and what kinds of kids yo u would see at Seneca.  There are two more interview rounds if you get past the first one.  Interviewer told us she would follow up with each interviewee about the status of their application by 5-7 business days-- however, it has been 2 weeks and I have not received an update.
Interview Questions: What would you share about your personal life to one of your clients/kids and why? (or something to that effect)

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I got an email from the current Senior Administrative Assistant of the Executive Director of Crisis Services asking me if I'd be interested in an interview. We scheduled things, and it all went pretty smoothly. A week later, I drove to San Leandro, walked into the front office, and waited for the Director to show up. The wait time was good; it only lasted a few minutes. I was then greeted by the Director, and we walked over to where her office was. The overall interview process was pretty standard, but there was one thing that went wrong: Mid-conversation, she stopped us so that she could text/ send an email/ whatever on her phone. I then proceeded to sit there in awkward, uncomfortable silence, for at least 5 minutes. I know that 5 minutes isn't very long in the big picture. HOWEVER. As an interviewer, you must know that the interviewee is already extremely nervous and receptive of any signals you are giving them. So, to the interviewee, 5 minutes feels MUCH longer than it really is. And pulling such a rude stunt in the middle of an interview shows that you do not have respect for the person who is showing interest in working for you and your company. I have never been in this kind of situation before. 

Anyways, after that happened, we continued with the interview. The Director seemed extremely terse and distant, which also was a bad sign for me. In the end, she started seeming less and less interested in what we were doing, like she had somewhere better to be. When I asked her my questions that I had for her, she gave me very short and sometimes unhelpful answers. I know that she is a busy woman, and the fact that she was giving me such a bad vibe was just a standard, tell-tale sign that I was not the right candidate. My only problem is, however, that she seemed disinterested right from the get-go. If you already knew that I wasn't a good fit for this position, why did you even bother to interview me in the first place? So much time, gas money, effort, and stress could have been spared if you did us both the favor of not reaching out to me in the first place. Since you did do so, at least give me the basic respect that professionals give to each other.

One more thing: At the end of our interview, the Director told me that they would get back to me with a decision within the next week. It had been more than two weeks until they got back to me. I understand that you are extremely busy and that interviewing may not be the top priority right now. But don't say things that you don't mean. Even a "We honestly don't know when we'll get back to you" would have been better, because then I wouldn't be confused and concerned when one week goes by and I don't even get an update email.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Seneca?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
The entire interview process took a little over two months from the time I applied. First I attended a group interview with about 10 other people. Seneca kindly tries to lessen the pressure by pooling interviewees who are not necessarily interested in the same positions or locations. The interview did feel less competitive and nerve-wracking this way, but it was still awkward at moments. It's discussion based, so prepare yourself to jump in and formulate original answers to a question 10 people have just answered. It seemed pretty clear to me that the group interview's purpose is to find out how well you can listen to, talk with and work with others. Almost all of the open positions were described as very team-oriented. 

The second interview was a 1 on 1 with a program supervisor. This experience was completely fine. My interviewer was a little late, but they asked fair questions and gave time for me to ask questions and pick their brain about the job. They even asked some repeat questions from the group interview. It would be a good idea to prepare a list of emotional/behavioral signs that indicate a struggling child in advance. The program supervisor then set me up for the third and final interview, which is an interactive at one of their school sites.

This is where things got odd for me, and I suspect it's probably why I didn't get an offer. If you get to this point, you will be expected to head over to one of Seneca's schools where you will observe a Classroom Counselor, and they will in turn observe you as you interact/don't interact with the children. They will then report back to the program supervisor and supposedly give their opinion of you. 

This experience was the worst part of the process for me. My host was, honestly, quite rude the entire length of the procedure. They spoke to me, maybe, a total of three minutes out of the entire hour and a half interview. At the time, I brushed it off as them maintaining a sense of objectivity. I carried on and tried my best to interact with the kids while maintaining a sense of boundary. They gave no notice of interview time frames, no feedback or thoughts about my performance and no chance to ask ask about their job. I get the sense they were pretty annoyed that I was interrupting their day (understandable). If you have to do an interactive interview, I'd say be more assertive than I was about interacting with your host so you can better understand how they think a Classroom Counselor should act/carry out their job. I think I may have faired better if I'd tried to match my host's style of interacting with children in the classroom.

Final opinion, the strangest aspect of this interview process was being expected to interact with children who don't know you and won't continue to see you. Seneca seems to pride itself on building strong bonds with young people, but they think it's okay to send in random, transient strangers for the sole purpose of an interview. I didn't trust that my interactive host really took the time to assess how well I would have done the job. Even after asking for feedback twice, I was not given any. And, the process really just took way too long. I waited 3-4 weeks between each interview before I got responses.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you disagreed with your supervisor. What happened and what did you do?

My group consisted of 4 others and we were all applying for administrative positions for various locations.  The recruiter that led the interview was really nice and made us feel at ease. There seems like a lot of room for growth in this organization and it has been a good experience so far.

It was pretty nerve-wracking because she was asking the questions in rapid-fire mode. I thought I did pretty badly because my nerves got to me, but they still ended up calling me back in. The second interview was with another recruiter. It was a much more friendly atmosphere and speaking with this person and learning more about the various projects really made me want to work for Seneca. I thought I did significantly better in handling my nervousness. I was rushed out of the interview because he had another appointment right after and we were already over our time (which I took as a good sign). Ultimately I didn't get the position but had a pretty good experience interviewing with Seneca. The only thing that irked me was that the wait in between calls are about a week so the whole process took over a month.

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my application for the MH Therapist position in SF and was contacted via email 2 days later by the Clinical Supervisor of their Early Childhood MH program (Building Blocks Preschool) in Oakland to set up an interview for the MH Consultant position. I was surprised to receive an invitation to interview for that position because it was a different one than what I'd applied to (!), but decided to do so since it was a good match based on my clinical experiences.

The Skype interview was set up for a few days later over Skype, lasted about 1.5 hours and was generally pleasant. The questions asked were of average difficulty and used to gauge experience, comfort level and cultural fit within the agency. I was invited for a 2nd on-site interview that never happened (they ended up hiring someone else before getting to see me again), and was told that my resume would be passed back to HR for further consideration elsewhere.

Overall, the application and interview process was smooth and positive. I do however wish there was more transparency as to how and when the agency makes hiring decisions so that I can plan accordingly.
Interview Questions: Q: How did you or would you deal with a parent who was absolutely disinterested in your work with their child?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview

I submitted cover letter and resume through their website and received a call from HR about a week later. They did a basic screening and scheduled me for a group interview later that week and emailed me an application packet to fill out and bring to the interview.

Group interview consisted of about 10 applicants and 1 interviewer seated around a conference table. Most applicants were either applying for different positions or different locations, so it was not competitive. There were general questions that anyone who wanted to could answer, and scenario/personal experience questions that everyone was expected to answer. At the end, the interviewer went over all the positions available, their locations, the starting pay for each, and benefits. 

Interviewer was friendly and chatty when explaining things, but stone-faced when listening to people answer questions. I understand it's to remain unbiased, but it led to a lot of awkward moments. They email everyone a few days after the interview, whether you get an offer or not, which is nice.
