title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was long, group interview.  One interviewee looked as if he did not even care to be there.  The other was very positive and bubbly.  It was awkward in that the questions were specific situations and almost everyone thought the same way, so it was basically like a game of who could speak better.
Interview Questions: After earning their trust, your youth is caught with a bag of weed. what do you do?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had the opportunity to attend the panel Interview in March. There were about 7-10 people in the room. The HR manager asked us a couple of questions about our prior experience with kids with drug use issues, family issues, and emotional issues  in the capacity of a counselor. Almost all of the questions he asked are situational which means you should have some experience from your job that enable you to deal with future problems.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with any conflicts that took place between you and your supervisor?

title: Case Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First was a group interview with other administrative positions, and was followed by a computer proficiency test where they tested me on Excel and Word programs. Following the computer test was  two individual interviews. They all were very casual in which they asked me about my resume and experience and details about the job. The only interview that felt formal was the group interview because you were answering specific questions and had to share the time with the other candidates.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to do something outside of your job description.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple. Went into a meeting room for group interview. Most of the interviewees were for the same job. Overall it was an easy group interview type where each person talks in turn.
Interview Questions: Basic information, what you would do in a stressful situation, if the phone is ringing and you have a customer waiting and you need to get papers ready for a meeting in 5 minutes?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to multiple positions with Seneca and was contacted about a month after I submitted the online application. They first called me and did a sort of phone screen type of interview then went ahead and scheduled me for a group interview later that week. I interviewed in San Leandro with two other women in my group. The male conducting our interview seemed as if he had a memorized speech and did not seem actually engaged with the answers the other women or I gave; instead, he seemed like a robot reading off a page of notes. A lot of the questions he asked were situational and had to do with "what-if" worst-case-scenario's in a classroom.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was a bit uncomfortable. Because the company focuses on altruistic intentions, I expected the interviewer to be at least somewhat of a warm person. However, the interviewer was extremely robotic and rather cold. They recited the interview questions monotonously, stared blankly at me while I answered them, and then immediately jumped to the next question as soon as I was done speaking. The interviewer asked a mix of basic and practice-based questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with diverse populations?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. About 10 people sitting in a round table. Being asked pretty basic questions, such as " why do you want to work here?""Do you know what type of children we work with?""why do you want to work with these children?"" what woud you do if ...."? atc
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Recieved a call from a recruiter right after, asked me briefly whether I have the minimum qualification or not and set me up with a group interview.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about Seneca

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I found it to be a very comprehensive and thorough interview process and I can see why now that I work there. Seneca only hires high-quality candidates who they feel fit with the company values and are passionate about the youth and families. This is difficult, but meaningful and awesome work and they clearly want to weed out those who aren't truly called to the work.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience working with youth and families.

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Before coming in for an interview, the agency called to ask a few questions about how I found out about the job and why it is that I wanted the position. They then asked me about my availability and which location I would like to work in. At the end of the phone call, they asked me what days I am available for a group interview. 

The group interview consisted of about 8 people including me. Everyone at the group interview were applying for various positions at Seneca. During the interview, it kind of felt like a competition on who could answer the quickest and best. Since there were quite a few of us, it was hard to not say something similar to what someone has said before.
Interview Questions: This is a scenario question. What if you walked into a room and a child yells and says for you to stay away from them and uses profanity? How would you approach the situation?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. It was fun being able to interact with other people. You can see management is very passionate about their jobs and if accepted you would be apart of a great company.
Interview Questions: Biggest disappointment

title: Classroom Counselor/Behavioral Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview process. I thoroughly enjoyed my time interacting with the other applicants. We were asked questions and told to jump in whenever to answer the question. They want to see how you interact with others. I had a great time and developed a greater genuine interest in the company after the interview process.
Interview Questions: Given scenarios and how you would handle the situations

title: TBS Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a group interview. There were seven people including me being interviewed by one interviewer. We each had to answer the questions he posed, just chiming in whenever we thought of something instead of raising hands or going in a particular order. It took 2 hours. The second interview is in-person.
Interview Questions: "What do you think of the term "emotionally disturbed" when used to describe children?"

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Tustin, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward process. Applied and received a call in 3 days . They asked for me to come for an interview. They asked standard question like why do you want to work here? strengths, weakness, etc.
Interview Questions: Your strengths, weakness, why you want to work here, questions abut if i were in certain situations

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Multi-step interview process.  First interview was with Accounting Director and Controller, and took a quick Excel test on the computer before leaving.  Second interview was with the Accounting Director and Chief Financial Officer.
Interview Questions: How comfortable I was with the Mas 200/Sage 100 ERP program.

title: Mental Health Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received a call about a week after applying online.  I traveled to San Francisco for a group interview consisting of 7 individuals.    Felt like it went well. Was expecting a second interview that did not happen.
Interview Questions: What exactly do they want?

title: Peer Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and then was contacted about a week later for a phone interview. 
The phone interview went well, I was then invited for a group interview. 
The group interview was something new for me. It wasn't a panel, it was actually a group of other applicants in one room with 2 interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: you will first have a group interview. if you pass you move to a 1-1  and an interactive interview with the kids. The first interview was about 2 and half hours because there was about 15 of us. It was collaborative and we all communicated thoroughly as a team or like a seminar. The 1-1 is really chill, you get to know the team and staff, and experience how it would be if you were to work there! great process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call from HR about a week later. The HR representative asked me a few questions about my background and I was invited to a group interview. The group interview consisted of 3 other candidates and we were asked a variety of scenario questions. After the group interview, I was asked to come back to take a computer skills assessment test.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went through a  couple level of interviews. First was a phone call, then I was invited for a group interview, and finally, I was given a tour of the school where I could potentially be placed and introduced to people I could potentially work with. All three levels were very friendly. The group interview was particularly interesting because it had a very discussion feel.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this? If this happened with a child in the middle of the class, how would you handle it?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by phone shortly after and had an interview in person a few days later.  They email you a three page application, an Equal Opportunity Data Form, and an Education Authorization form to complete prior to the interview.  The interview lasted almost 2 hours including question and answer opportunity afterward.
Interview Questions: The questions were worded EXACTLY as described by previous reviewers so the interview is completely scripted.  No variance and nothing unexpected or unusual.

title: Case Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed a group of 5 possible candidates applying for various positions all at once. Which sucks because you don't get the direct attention or opportunity to shine as you would on a one to one interview. My first time doing this, and in all honesty it was dumb and not fair. I think the H&R people are dumb because it seems like they are taking the easy way out for doing group interviews. They honestly seemed like robots and showed no emotion whatsoever! it was weird!! They really need to take time to get to know the appliants one on one to give an equal chance and opportunity.
Interview Questions: Gave a scenario of five things occurring at once and how we would best address the situation.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume and cover letter in then about a week later I received a phone call from HR asking a few questions about why I wanted to work for the agency. Set up to come in for a group interview the following week which consisted of 8 people. There we were asked about our background and why we wanted to work for Seneca even though the children can sometimes be hard to handle. The interviewer then explained some behaviors and asked how we would respond to them. The hardest part was making sure you responded to each question and didn't just say I agree. Later in the week I got a call from a director in the city I wanted to work in asking to come in for a 1:1 and interactive interview. This was more formal they just wanted to know about you and went into more detail about the company and their school. During the interactive portion they allow you to interact with the children during the school day and they don't hover over you. They also asked for a simple writing sample just to make sure you were capable of doing the daily summaries. Then a few days later I received a call from the supervisor offering me the position!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: first they interview you over the phone, if they decide you are qualified they scheduled you for a group interview, if you like them, they will schedule you for a one on one
Interview Questions: what would you do if one of the kids insulted you?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Phone call from HR recruiter a week after applying online, asking why the position interested me, then talked about the requirements for the position. Scheduled for a group interview the following week. They e-mail you an application to fill out to bring with you to the interview. Group interview-5 people when I interviewed. Asked to name 3 strengths, and what a previous supervisor would say they would like you to improve on. How you handled a situation in a previous job that was a disaster. What kind of computer programs are you efficient in? They give you a situation and ask how you would handle it. After the interview questions, they tell you a little more about the company and the positions you are applying for. If they feel they have found a fit for you, then you will be given an excel/word test just so they know you know the basics. (not timed) After that, you will have a 1/1 interview with the supervisor of that specific program you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Nothing was unexpected. General interview questions.

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: They had me go through two lengthy interviews with the entire management team. The interviews were extremely in-depth and exhaustive.  Once I got in the company, I learned that they were very proud of how hard the hiring process was (and used that as proof that the people that were hired were the cream of the crop).
Interview Questions: They gave me a vignette that I had to write what I would do in that situation  even before I was brought into the interview. The interview itself was a lot of questions about my previous experience and "what are your greatest strengths/challenges" kinds of things.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is a group interview. My group had 6 other people in it. Then if you get a call back it is an situational interview. ie in the classroom. and after that a one on one personal interview. You are judged on how well  you interact with the other candidates and of course your answers. Seneca really values unconditional care for children,  when their behavior is not stellar.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the background of the kids we work with?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I had 3 total interviews plus the initial phone interview. Group Panel interview included myself and 6 other people. Informal, facilitator asked questions, everyone was given an opportunity to answer.

1:1 interview with director and manger, went into more detail about the company.

Interactive interview, in which applicant is evaluated based on their interaction with students.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're the best fit for this position

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Emailed resume and cover letter. Received a phone call from HR asking a few questions about why I wanted to work for the agency. Set up to come in for a group interview. Interview consisted of about 7-8 people asking about our background and why we wanted to work for Seneca. Gave a few scenarios and wanted to know what you would do in those instances.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child called you the b word?

title: Speech-Langauge Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: The director of the Fremont non-public school (where I had been contracting at the time) approached me and asked if I would be interested in a full time position that would include serving both the San Leandro and Fremont non-public school sites. I was then contacted for an interview with the San Leandro director on site.
Interview Questions: None. Both directors were straight forward and down to earth.

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received a call about a week after applying. Invited to a group interview of about 10 people which felt like a group discussion. BA level starts at $14 and MA start at $16.
Interview Questions: It is your first day at work and a child you have not spoken to before point to you and says, "I don't like that b*". What would you do?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Tustin, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Seneca recruiters went to my university and I submitted a resume. I got an email from Seneca about a week later with a link to current openings. I attended a group interview which consisted of the expected types of questions and was invited to stay for the computer test. I was called later that day to be scheduled for a 1:1 interview.
Interview Questions: What computer programs are you familiar with?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a message on my answering machine a few days later. I called back and was asked a few basic questions about why I wanted to work at Seneca and what my background was. It took about 10 minutes. I was then asked to come in for a group interview. The interviewer was very friendly but asked some difficult questions with some scenarios of what you would do if a student called you a a derogatory name, spit on you, ect. I think the most difficult part was getting your voice heard but not being pushy or repeating things that have already been said.
Interview Questions: What do you think the background is of the children who you will be dealing with?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I was called in for a group interview which right off the bat was extremely ineffective. The interviewer asked questions and told all 12-15 candidates to just call out the answers. It seemed to be too much of a competitive environment and gave little indication of an individuals contribution to the company.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was what would you do if a child called you a b**** without even knowing you (yes they really asked this)

title: Wraparound Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Was called for an interview by HR, who forwarded my name to the location I specified. At the location, I was first given a case description and asked to come up with questions I would have about the case and prioritize what needed attention (in writing). Then I was interviewed by two people, a manager of the whole group I would be working for, and a supervisor who was at the level directly above where I would be. Interview was an hour long, informal.
Interview Questions: How do you keep both the long-term treatment plan and the short-term goals and challenges of a case in mind at the same time?

title: Behavioral Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume and cover letter to HR. About three days letter I received a phone call; the HR representative asked me some questions and invited me to a group interview. I came to the group interview and there were 4-5 more people there. We were asked to talk about ourselves, why we wanted the job and why we wanted to work with Seneca. We were also given some scenarios and how we would react/respond to these cases. Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the exact words but it goes... What would I do if a child pointed at me and said "I do not want to work with that woman"? And how would I build rapport with said youth?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call in for a group interview about 3 days later. They ask you about 6 questions- What background do you think the kids that come here are from? These kids will be very curious about you and ask you all sorts of questions (personal questions) how do you deal with that? You are with one of your kids on probation for drugs and you find drugs on him what do you do?
Interview Questions: Most unexpected question was- These kids will spit on you, kick at you and call you every name in the book why do you want to work here?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Fairfield, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group interview first with 5-6 people and a hiring manager. Roundtable. Be friendly and relaxed with other applicants. Very basic computer skills test is next - microsoft word and basic excel. Finally, a one-on-one interview with a counselor or other higher up. It's very clear that they are committed to creating a safe, friendly work environment, and communicating that you understand that and can handle the pressure of the center is essential.
Interview Questions: How would you make this office a better place?

title: Classroom Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview environment was very laid back and and genuine. After reading qualifications, some questions were asked and scenarios were given. It was a group interview so we all collaboratively answered.

I was a bit surprised how negatively the kids that attend Seneca were portrait during the interview. I am not sure if it was to see the reaction of interviewees or if its it true.
Interview Questions: These kids will spit in your face, kick and punch you and call you every name in the book, why do you want to work with them?

title: Family Permanence Facilitator, Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then played phone tag with the HR department for weeks. Finally scheduled an interview and once I passed the initial 1:1 interview, HR checked my references and then had a discussion about the jobs that were available at Seneca. When I discussed positions I would be interested in I went in for a second 1:1 for that specific position and got an offer two days later.
Interview Questions: Most questions were expected asking questions about considerations for different populations and how I understand wraparound. I heard that they look for responses about how you understand your role on the team, how to work collaboratively with community partners and that you ask clarification questions about potential concerns you may have about the case.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, very brief phone screen with HR recruiter who asked why I applied to Seneca and confirmed whether I met the minimum qualifications, then was invited to group interview the following week.

Five other candidates were at the group interview. The HR recruiter first asked us to introduce ourselves and then asked a series of behavioral questions: strengths and weaknesses; how you handled a difficult person; how you managed a difficult situation; how you stay organized; how you would prioritize multiple tasks.

At the end of the 1-hour group interview, we were told that they would let us know whether we were continuing in the process within a week. The next steps would have been a 1-hour Word/Excel test, and then a 1-on-1 interview with the prospective supervisor.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take if you were manning the front desk and two phone lines started ringing, then a person walked in the door to be helped, then the Sheriff walked in the door, and you had to make 10 copies for a meeting in 5 minutes, as well as prep the conference room for that meeting?

title: Community Partnership Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
- Initial interview was timely and basic interview questions were asked. The front desk admin were hospitable and sincere throughout all my interview appointments.
- The next step was a computer test in word and excel to ensure knowledge of those programs.
- The next interview was with the Division's Director and went very well. Questions about my work and how I see myself doing this position. I was also able to feel like I could ask any questions that had come up from my end.
- Final interview was at their headquarters where I was asked similar job performance and personality questions as in the prior interview. I felt very comfortable and like I had a safe space to say whatever I was thinking.
-Throughout the entire interview process Seneca was extremely good with their communication and each time I received a call the following day about the status of my hiring process.
Interview Questions: I was asked to name a time when I knew I could of done something differently or better to achieve a certain outcome.

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and met with the Clinical Director of the program. The process has since changed and starts with a group interview and then a subsequent interview in the specific program.
Interview Questions:
Talk about a challenged you faced with a client.
Talk about something you feel especially proud of (professionally).

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions:
After seeing an ad for an executive assistant position within Seneca Family of Agencies, I replied with my resume and cover letter. Several days later, I received a call from their HR rep, who asked me what drew me to a job with Seneca, and ran through their list of minimum qualifications. At the end of the phone screening, the HR rep told me that she wanted to invite me to a group interview for the following week and we set up a date and time.

The group interview turned out to just be myself and one other person. A hr rep came and asked us both questions and we took turns answering first. He then went through a packet which discussed their benefits, job offerings, training, etc. At the end of the interview, we were told that we would hear about the position and whether or not we would continue in the interview process within 4-5 business days.

Two business days later, I received an email which informed me that they did not have a position to offer me, and wished me luck in my ongoing job search.
Interview Questions: "What steps would you take if you were manning the front desk and two phone lines started ringing, then a person walked in the door to be helped, then the Sheriff walked in the door... and you had to make 10 copies for a meeting in 5 minutes, as well as prep the conference room for that meeting?"

title: Wraparound Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: Considering the large amount of applicants Seneca has, they first do a group interview with about 8-10 people. Seneca does not like outspoken people who overpower others, which is why it's best to sit back, answer questions, but do not be the person where everyone is annoyed at you for answering every single question obnoxiously. Fortunately, I got to skip the group interview and went directly to meeting with the Director of the location I applied for. After answering an insane amount of questions and completing a case study, I was asked for a 2nd interview and was then hired. They are VERY choosy when it comes to hiring, and they pick you apart until they decide you're fit for the job.
Interview Questions: You are at a home visit after receiving a phone call on the crisis phone, a teenager has told you that she wants to slit her wrists at home and her mother is a known alcoholic and her brother is on drugs. It's late at night and you've already been at the home for several hours with the girl, it's now approaching bed time. The girl is still saying she'll slit her wrists. What do you do?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: In Sonoma...Emailed my cover letter and resume on Sunday, got a call to set up interview on Monday.  Interview was on Tuesday, it was a group interview.  Really felt like we were competing head to head to answer questions.  They called me on Weds to set up appointment for second interview on Thursday.  They contacted for offer 10 business days later.
Interview Questions: Senario question with difficult child.

title: Wraparound Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Somewhat disjointed and tangential. Two face to face interviews at different dates and locations. Interviewers were friendly, but not necessarily prepared for interview process. Lengthy wait time after arrival to both interviews. Prior to meeting with initial interviewer, I was asked to complete a lengthy questionnaire which was never referred to during the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Seneca? What do you do for fun?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial call to set up a group interview. There were about 6 other potential hires there. After that interview I had an interactive interview where I went into a classroom and interacted with current clients and staff, followed by a one on one interview with the director of the program I was interviewing for a position with.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you walked in to your first day in the classroom and a kid immediately yelled "F*!k you B*tch"? How would you react?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone and asked to come in for an on site interview and writing sample. Writing sample was easy, just a basic vignette. Was a very relaxed environment and somewhat informal interview with Program Director and outgoing Care Coordinator. Asked the usual questions about strengths, weaknesses etc.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had trouble working with a co-worker/supervisor? What did you do, and how did it turn out?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Saw the ad on craigslist, and had three interviews--one group interview in Oakland, two individual interviews in Santa Rosa. I was warned that the HR process of checking references takes awhile and it had all seemed to go well, but after waiting a month I sent an email inquiry and was told they did not have a position to offer me. I find that very confusing, since I have an MA (the job only required a BA) and they are currently advertising multiple job openings.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I had handled crisis situations in the past.

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume and got a call back in about a week. They did an initial phone interview, then I went to a group interview. The group interview was interesting, but went well. They called me back for an individual interview, which I went to as well.
Interview Questions: Please describe wraparound counseling

title: Case Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a quick screening interview (verifying that I met the minimum qualifications of Bachelor's Degree, 21 years old, Driver's License, etc.) and then invited to a group interview. There were about 8 other applicants in the group interview. After the group interview, I was invited back for a computer test and individual interview. The entire process from applying to being hired was about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you disagreed with a supervisor? They also give scenarios around organization skills and time management for admin support position interviews.

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took about 3 weeks from sending in my cover letter and resume to job offer. Sometime in late February of 2013, I applied online via Craigslist on a Monday or something. I received a phone call from HR later that week (Wednesday or Thursday) for what felt like a brief and informal phone interview as well as to schedule an appointment for a group interview at their main office in Oakland, California. I went to the group interview the following Monday. There were several candidates present who applied for various positions in different Seneca programs. I approached the group interview non-competitively, which I think HR valued. HR would ask the group a question and it's up to you to respond. HR may follow up to see if anyone else has anything else to say before moving on to the next question, but it's better if you take the initiative and/or build off of each other. After I completed the group interview, HR requested to complete additional information such as professional references, etc. I received a call a few days later and was informed that I moved onto 1:1 interviews at the program-specific location. We scheduled the first of two 1:1 interviews in the beginning of the next week. I was interviewed (though the person was not physically present--I was in a conference room and the interviewer Skyped). Either before or after the first interview, the program assistant provides you with a written prompt. I received a phone call shortly after (a day or two) to schedule another 1:1 interview with my direct supervisor later that week. That interview formerly lasted about 5 minutes before he offered me the job and then we informally talked for the next half hour or so. Received my confirmation email from Seneca that day with my new hire information and scheduled my fantastic 2-week orientation!
Interview Questions: Group Interview Question: Tell me about yourself, your educational background, and what position you are applying for.

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Jose, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I don't know how to even make this 50 words...they honestly called me, talked AT me on the phone for about 15 minutes, asked me to visit the school site, talked at me some more, then offered me the job.  I really don't think I answered a single question about myself or my experiences.  It was almost as if I was interviewing them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Wraparound Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews with Seneca, the first was a group interview with 6-7 other applicants. This was a bit daunting at first as I thought we were all interviewing for the same position! However there were a variety of people interviewing for different positions and only a handful of people interested in the job that I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would handle a situation in which a child was escalated or upset.

title: Peer Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview. Not difficult at all.
Interview Questions: Very easy questions

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume in via the company website, since I saw the listing on craigslist. They usually do group interviews but had me come in for a 1:1 due to timing contraints. I met with HR, then a day or two later met with a Supervisor. I completed a short essay about a case. The Supervisor interview was very good, honest questions and positive. They completed a 2 week background check and I heard back right after that.
Interview Questions: If a child starts swearing at you and displays certain behaviors what would you do?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call asking me to come to a group interview at the Oakland office; there were about 6 other applicants there. Questions were asked to the group in general, and you had to take the initiative to contribute to the discussion and offer ideas. From there I was called to schedule a one to one interview with the director of the program I would potentially be working at. It was relatively informal; we met in his office and the interview style was very conversational. From there, my references were checked, which took the longest time by far. Overall it took me about 6 or 7 weeks from the initial contact to the time I was hired. Once I was hired, I started basic training the following week [which you receive pay for]
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for an interview about two weeks after applying for the job.  It was a group interview with about six other people and one recruiter.  The recruiter asked basic questions (what drew you to the organization, positive and negative things a previous supervisor would say about you) and we would take turns saying our response.  The atmosphere was very casual and friendly.
Interview Questions: What is something your previous supervisor would say is a negative attribute of yours?

title: Family Support Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took about 3 weeks. Human Resources first reached out to me for an informal phone interview asking me why I was interested in the job and a little history about my experience. I then went in for a group interview with about 6 other people and they asked basic situational questions about working with youth, what some of the skills you have and how you seperate work and personal life. At the end of the interview they give a list of openings within the agency and have you write your top three so you would have more chances of being given an opportunity. I was scheduled for a second interview the same day. The second interview was the supervisor of the specific program and was also very situation and more focused on the position. In addition to the interview, I also met some client to see how my interactions with them were like and a glimpse into what my work day would look like. I got the job a week later.
Interview Questions: questions were basic, situation scenarios of a typical day at work. "what would you do if there was a child who was secluded from the group and when you approached you, she cursed at you?"

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Seneca Family of Agencies has a group interview, followed by a series of individual interviews. Many people are not given a chance to participate in the group interview process. If you make it past the group interview the site or workplace interested in your skill set will continue the interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work environment? Why do you want to work with at risk youth?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies (San Leandro, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Seneca Center was a pleasure to interview with. The staff are friendly. There was a group interview with approximately 2 other applicants. Everyone was asked the same questions and the order of how the applicants answered questions was flexible. The atmosphere was casual and relaxed. I interviewed one time but I am unsure if other applicants were asked to come back.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. The questions were typical of what would be asked at a job interview. The most difficult would probably be What is your greatest weakness?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Seneca Family of Agencies in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: When I received a call back from Seneca to schedule an interview, the HR lady was very nice on the phone. On the day of the interview, I found the HR place pretty easily. The receptionist was also very helpful and told me where the interview would be held. It was also a group interview (which I had never done before so I was curious to know how the process would go). There ended up being 9 candidates in one room and one lady telling us about the company and the kinds of things that are faced on a weekly basis. Everyone introduced themselves and the interviewer asked questions to which everyone gave an answer in an informal way. It seemed more of a discussion. Afterwards I felt pretty cool with the other candidates. The interviewer then gave us more information on various positions at the company that we could apply for. She said that someone would contact us within 5 business days and who the call would be coming from and there would be a 2nd and 3rd interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child who blatantly dislikes you the second you meet?
